enigma_edit.lua.data

Interface WoCall

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WoCallAPI20

    public interface WoCall
    Base class for any call, that is used to create the world. this includes the API 2.0 function wo as well as the API 1.0 function CreateWorld and the old create_world.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Tile getDefaultTile(Mode2 mode)
      Returns the tile declaration used, when no object was defined.
      MMSimpleValue getHeight()
      Get the worlds height (in tiles).

    • Method Detail

      • getTile

        Tile getTile(int x,
             int y)
        Resolve the tile for the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the field (1 <= x <= width)
        y - Y coordinate of the field (1 <= y <= height)
        Returns:
        ImageTile at the specified position (x,y) on the map; or null, if the position is outside of the map or if the resolver fails.

      • getDefaultTile

        Tile getDefaultTile(Mode2 mode)
        Returns the tile declaration used, when no object was defined.
        Parameters:
        mode - Mode to resolve the tile for.
        Returns:
        Default tile for the given mode.

      • getWidth

        int getWidth(Mode mode)
        Get the worlds width (in tiles).
        Parameters:
        mode - Mode to check the world for.
        Returns:
        The width of the requested world (in tiles). Or -1, in case of non-unique result.

      • getWidth

        MMSimpleValue getWidth()
        Get the worlds width (in tiles).
        Returns:
        The width of the requested world (in tiles).

      • getHeight

        int getHeight(Mode mode)
        Get the worlds height (in tiles).
        Parameters:
        mode - Mode to check the world for.
        Returns:
        The height of the requested world (in tiles).

      • getHeight

        MMSimpleValue getHeight()
        Get the worlds height (in tiles).
        Returns:
        The width of the requested world (in tiles).
